com.bill.java.api.models

Class Invoice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bill.java.api.net.ApiResource
      • com.bill.java.api.models.Invoice

  • public class Invoice
extends ApiResource

    Represents products and/or services purchased by a Customer from your organization. The nested invoiceLineItems array records products or services.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Invoice.InvoiceLineItem
      Represents a product or service

      • sendInvoice

        public static java.lang.Boolean sendInvoice(SendInvoiceRequestParams sendInvoiceRequestParams)
                                     throws BDCException,
                                            java.io.IOException
        Emails an invoice to emails specified in the request params. The email ("headers" and "content") are customized with template tokens. If tokens are not specified in the call, parameters are pulled from the Default Email Template.

        NOTE: the API cannot change the Default Email Template. Edits to the template MUST be made on the Bill.com UI. Use tokens (exactly as shown) to dynamically populate information in the email body. When sent, tokens are replaced with data. {:Customer.Name:} – customer for the invoice. {:Invoice.Number:} – invoice # for the invoice {:Invoice.AmountDue:} – amount due {:Invoice.DueDate:} – invoice due date {:Link_Pay_Invoice:} – URL of your company’s Bill.com Customer Portal.

        Parameters:
        sendInvoiceRequestParams - data for sending an Invoice
        Returns:
        true if emails sent successfully
        Throws:
        BDCException - when the response from the API is unsuccessful
        java.io.IOException - when an I/O exception occurs on the underlying request

      • mailInvoice

        public static java.lang.Boolean mailInvoice(MailInvoiceRequestParams mailInvoiceRequestParams)
                                     throws BDCException,
                                            java.io.IOException
        If your Customer is not part of the Bill.com network, use this call to send invoices via US mail.

        The specified invoice will be printed and mailed from Bill.com to the Customer. On the Bill.com UI, this is applied on the Invoice option to "Send via US Mail".

        Parameters:
        mailInvoiceRequestParams - data for sending an Invoice via mail
        Returns:
        true if emails sent successfully
        Throws:
        BDCException - when the response from the API is unsuccessful
        java.io.IOException - when an I/O exception occurs on the underlying request

                                    throws BDCException,
                                           java.io.IOException

        Parameters:
